intro: Cycnium camporum, commonly known as the redroot hogweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and some toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, umbrella-like compound leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters at the top of the plant. Cycnium camporum is often found in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and roadsides.
